Uses of Package
model

  • Packages that use model 
    Package Description
    controller  
    model  
    view  
  • Classes in model used by controller 
    Class and Description
    Level
    A class to hold anything that all Levels have in common This includes: The Game board values Score milestones (1/2/3 stars) Number of special moves As well as some common behavior associated with these attributes
    LightningLevel 
  • Classes in model used by model 
    Class and Description
    AbstractTileContainer
    The abstract representation of a TileContainer in the Board.
    Achievement
    System for achievements.
    Board
    The model that represents the board.
    IMove
    The generic Move interface All moves have to be able to have tiles added, and push themselves to a level They also have to know whether or not they are valid
    IOnLevelAchievement
    Acheivements that are calculated after the completion of a level.
    Level
    A class to hold anything that all Levels have in common This includes: The Game board values Score milestones (1/2/3 stars) Number of special moves As well as some common behavior associated with these attributes
    LevelState 
    LightningLevel 
    LightningTimer 
    OnMoveAchievement
    Acheivements that are calculated after each move is made.
    Tile
    A tile is the actual data contained by a Square on the board Each tile should always be inside a TileContainer Tiles have a number and a multiplier
    UserMove
    UserMove is the basic move type for the SixesWild game They are the only way to score points or mark tiles in Elimination rounds A valid UserMove is 2 or more adjacent tiles that sum to 6
  • Classes in model used by view 
    Class and Description
    AbstractTileContainer
    The abstract representation of a TileContainer in the Board.
    EliminationLevel
    The goal of an elimination level is to use every tile once in a UserMove (Special moves do not count) You have a certain number of moves to try to accomplish this, and if you do not mark all tiles before you run out of moves, you lose
    Level
    A class to hold anything that all Levels have in common This includes: The Game board values Score milestones (1/2/3 stars) Number of special moves As well as some common behavior associated with these attributes
    LightningLevel 
    PuzzleLevel 
    ReleaseLevel
    Release levels have a number of buckets.
